results.title: Basics of direct instruction
results.brief_description: Gives an overview of the Direct Instruction technique which was developed in the 1960’s to develop successful students with a positive approach and works on problem solving skills so students learn to learn. Skills are broken into sub-skills until mastered and integrated. Notes the goals, assumptions and characteristics of Direct Instruction programmes, provides a brief description of teaching techniques and how to prepare a Direct Instruction program.

results.title: Methods
results.creator_credit: De Frenes and United States. Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates the correct posture for typing and proper fingering of the keys; shows the use of the shift key, back spaces, tabulator, carriage return lever, and other parts on both manual and electric machines; also discusses the funtion of various fixtures on the machine. Correct use of single sheets and carbon pack is also demonstrated, together with the use of the paper lever and carriage release lever.

results.title: Machine operation
results.creator_credit: De Frenes and United States. Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates correct stroking at speeds ranging from 35 to 180 words per minute. Explains the functions of the various parts of the typewriter and demonstrates the use of these on various types of machines. Demonstrates how to attain correct touch for noiseless, manual, and electric machines.

results.title: Basic training and conditioning: weight training. No. 2
results.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films
results.brief_description: Shows the role played by muscles in various athletic events and illustrates the different exercises necessary for muscle development. A brief examination of the fibres of the muscles is given explaining how they function and how muscles are strengthened; preliminary conditioning for a young athlete training for shot putting, showing him incorporating and practising a weight training program; and the muscles emphasised in discus throwing, the high jump, and the javelin, and the weight training associated with each.

results.title: Basic training and conditioning: weight training. No. 1
results.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films
results.brief_description: Expresses the opinion that much of the athletic achievement in recent years has been due to weight training and indicates the events associated with weight training or weight lifting. The part played by the various muscles in these events are pointed out, and the training program for developing these muscles illustrated and described.
